dict.string: A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited. Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier
The type of the payload, a reverse dns string.
The version of the whole configuration profile.
This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user.
Defines the AD domain youâ€™re working with.
An indication of what specific LDAP type is in use. Currently only "OD" for Apple's Open Directory is available.
Determines if NoMAD uses LDAP over SSL.
Allow anonymous LDAP binding when getting the user record.
Sets NoMAD to treat the remote server as just an LDAP server and not specifically AD.
List of LDAP servers to use instead of doing SRV lookups.
List of custom attributes to query in AD on each user record lookup. Attributes will be written back to the UserAttributes key.
Append your AD domain to the end of the user's home folder. Used for when the home in AD is not fully qualified.
Allows for recursive group lookups in AD to find all nested groups a user may be a member of.
Kerberos realm to use to get Kerberos tickets as a side affect of authentication.
Determines if the Kerberos tickets should be renewed or not.
Number of seconds until the Kerberos ticket is renewed.
Ensures that the local user name is the active ticket being used by NoMAD.
For when macOS User Switching is enabled.
Determines if the kasspwd server is written out to the com.apple.Kerberos preference domain.
Tells NoMAD to update your Chrome settings to allow for Kerberos auth with your AD domain.

Tells NoMAD to update your Chrome settings to allow for Kerberos auth for the set domain. This allows for Chrome to work with domains other than your AD Domain. Note that the domain will be automatically wildcarded, so setting a domain of "nomad.test" will result in *nomad.test being set. Multiple domains are supported, separate them by ","
Determines if the Kerberos password is stored in the user's keychain.
Determines if the Kerberos password is synchronized with the local account.
Only sync the password if the account name is the same as the local account name.
Only Sync Local Password on Match
Local users that will not synchronize their password.
Local Users to Not Sync Password
AD users that will not synchronize their password.
Network Users to Not Sync Password
Items to update when the user's local password is updated as well.
Updates keychain items on every sign in. Used for debugging.
Enables a secondary password change with AD to fix an issue with macOS 10.13.0 with AD-bound mobile accounts.
Complexity policy for changing the password via Kerberos.
Will show visual indicators to the user when changing his or her password that it does not meet policy. Note: the values need to be set as Strings in your dictionary.
Minimum # of lowercase letters required in password
Minimum # of uppercase letters required in password
Minimum # of numbers required in password
Minimum # of symbols required in password
Minimum # of password policies that must be met (not including length)

For example, entering a value of 3 when you configure uppercase, lowercase, number, and symbol requirements will permit a password that matches only 3 of the 4 requirements. Users will always have to meet the configured minimum password length, regardless of this setting.
Script or other binary to run when a password is successfully changed.
Task, URL or App path for ChangePasswordType. (<<serial>>, <<fullname>>, <<shortname>> and <<domain>> are currently supported as substitutions)
Hides the password countdown display in the menu bar.
Message text to show in the menu bar when the password countdown has been suppressed.
Number of seconds before a user's password expiration that an alert is shown. (Set to 0 to never be bothered. Defaults to 15 days or 1,296,000 seconds.)
The threshold, in seconds, for when to start notifying the user about their expiring password â€“ set to 0 to never be bothered, and defaults to 15 days or 1,296,000 seconds
Custom alert to show in the menu bar instead of days to go.
Number of days remaining before the custom alert is shown, and in yellow.
Number of days remaining before the custom alert is shown, and in red.
Alerts the user to Unannounced Password Changes, typically when the password was changed in AD and not from the user's system.
Message to be shown in an UPCAlert notification.
Path to a script or other binary to execute when a UPC Alert occurs.
Automatically request a certificate for a user when they don't have a valid certificate in the keychain.
Number of days until the certificate expires before automatically renewing it.
Allows the private key from any NoMAD generated certificate to be exported.
Automatically remove extra certificates from the user's keychain. This will leave the 2 newest and the 2 oldest certificates.
FQDN of the Windows web CA for NoMAD to use for certificates.
Certificate template to request when using the Windows CA.
A list of wireless networks that the certificate created by NoMAD should be associated with.
Removes the icon from the menu bar. Note that NoMAD still is in the menu bar, just with no icon and taking up less space.
Use the Finder instead of the API for automounted file shares.
URL or Path for GetHelpType (<<serial>>, <<fullname>>, <<shortname>> and <<domain>> are currently supported as substitutions)
File path for a Self Service application not found automatically.
Hides the Get Software menu item.
Hides the Get Help menu item.
Shows the Home Directory share menu item.
Hides the Lock Screen menu item.
Hides the Renew Tickets menu item.
Hides the Sign Out menu item.
Shows the password expiration countdown even when the user is not logged into the domain.
Message text to show in the menu bar when NoMAD is not connected to the AD domain.
Your password is required to have 128 characters.
Message text to display in the password change dialog to help the user understand how complex they need to be.
Message text for when a user is asked for their local password to sync their network password to their local account.
Menu item text for the About item.
Menu item text for the Change Password item.
Menu item text for the File Servers item.
Menu item text for the Get Certificate item.
Menu item text for the Get Software item.
Menu item text for the Get Help item.
Menu item text for the Home Directory item.
Menu item text for the Renew Tickets item.
Menu item text for the user name item before a user logs in.
Menu item text for the password expiration item before a user logs in.
Changes the icon set to Carrie the Caribou.
Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar when NoMAD is connected.
Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar when NoMAD is not connected.
Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar when NoMAD is connected in dark mode.
Path to a 16x16 pixel image to use as the icon in the menu bar when NoMAD is not connected in dark mode.
Adds NoMAD to the userâ€™s start up items.
Path to a script or command to be run after a successful sign in.
Path to a script or other binary to be run on sign out.
Path to a script that will be launched on network changes.
Keyword to determine what auto configuration scheme to use.
Hides the Welcome window on first launch.
Shows the Welcome window on first launch, but checks the "Donâ€™t show again" box by default.
Path to a folder containing an index.html file and associated resources for displaying as a Welcome window.
Shows the Sign In window on launch.
Shows the Sign In window on launch unless the user has a password in the keychain.
Makes the Sign In window the foremost window when a user is not signed in.
Time in seconds between the SignInWindowAlert making the Sign In window the foremost window.
Title of the Sign In window.
Local users that will not be shown the Sign In window automatically.
